Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery vessel, the interior is spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and bears very faint traces of a number of lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393298) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393298)
